hints.content: Every time we move right on the number line, we add the distance we move.

$571\redE{+90}=661$

[[☃ image 1]]

Let's keep adding to label the other points on the number line.

options.alt: A number line with 3 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 571, 661, and question mark. An arrow labeled plus 90 is above the number line beginning at 571 and ending at 661. !

A number line with 3 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 571, 661, and 663. An arrow labeled plus 90 is above the number line beginning at 571 and ending at 661. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at 661 and ending at 663. !

hints.content:
This leads to the same sum because, altogether, that is a distance of:

$\redE{90}+\purpleE{2}= \blueE{92}$

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line with 3 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 571, 661, and 663. An arrow labeled plus 90 is above the number line beginning at 571 and ending at 661. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at 661 and ending at 663. An arrow labeled plus 92 is above the number line beginning at 571 and ending at 663. !

hints.content:
This is Liberato's completed number line:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line with 3 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 571, 661, and 663. An arrow labeled plus 90 is above the number line beginning at 571 and ending at 661. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at 661 and ending at 663. An arrow labeled plus 92 is above the number line beginning at 571 and ending at 663. !

question.content:
Liberato thinks about $571+\blueE{92}$ as $571+\redE{90}+\purpleE{2}$ to solve in his head. Here is part of a number line to represent his thinking.

[[☃ image 1]]

**Which number line correctly labels the other tick marks?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A number line with 3 unequally spaced tick marks. From left to right, the tick marks are labeled 571, an unlabeled tick mark, and an unlabeled tick mark. An arrow labeled plus 90 is above the number line beginning at 571 and ending at the first unlabeled point. An arrow labeled plus 2 is above the number line beginning at the first unlabeled point and ending at the second unlabeled point. An arrow labeled plus 92 is above the number line beginning at 571 and ending at the second unlabeled point. !
